newsitem.title: USA: North America bunkers weaker, but ECoast may rise.
newsitem.headline: North America bunkers weaker, but ECoast may rise.

text.p: North American bunker prices continued to slip late this week as the market remained lackluster in demand amid good supply, players said on Thursday.
The East Coast, however, was showing signs of a slight rebound after falling off about two cents on Wednesday.

Resupply was reported tightening in the hub, which gave a slight uptick to New York Harbor values. Harbor spot 380 CST, however, was still down $2 from Tuesday's levels to between $118 a tonne and $120 a tonne.
